content.title: Intro
content.content:
1948
Preceded by
1948
1949
Year
1950
Followed by
1950

Tolkien-related events that took place in 1949.

content.title: January
content.content: 28 - The letter "Cardinal Mindszenty", co-signed by J.R.R. Tolkien, is published in The Times.

content.title: February
content.content:
15 - Scholar Alexei Kondratiev is born.
28 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes Letter 119.

content.title: March
content.content:
11 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes a letter to Miss Turnbull.
16 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes letter 120.
20 - J.R.R. Tolkien visits Hugh Brogan in Cambridge.

content.title: April
content.content: 9 - Sorcha Cusack, who would play Goldberry in Tales from the Perilous Realm (1992 radio series), is born.

content.title: June
content.content: 4 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes a letter to Pauline Baynes.

content.title: July
content.content:
13 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes letter 121.
14 - Tolkien author and screenwriter Brian Sibley is born.

content.title: October
content.content:
20 - Farmer Giles of Ham is published.
? - A fair, revised typescript of the finished The Lord of the Rings is made a copy.[1]

content.title: November
content.content: 12 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes a letter to Miss How.

content.title: December
content.content:
12 - Bill Nighy, who would play Samwise Gamgee in The Lord of the Rings 1981 radio series, is born.
18 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes letter 122.
20 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes letter 122a.

? - Christopher Tolkien gets his B.A. English at Trinity College, Oxford.
Autumn - Tolkien is introduced to editor Milton Waldman.

content.title: References
content.content:
